description: The average time you spent with email and meetings each week.
The length of time between your first email or meeting and last email or meeting each day.
The average time you spent with email and meetings outside regular business hours each week.
The average time you spent in meetings each week.
The average time you spent with email each week.
The time you cost the organization with email and meetings.
The average time others spent on email and meetings you created each week.
The number of 2-hour blocks of time you had between meetings each day 8 am to 5 pm.
The average time you were scheduled in simultaneous meetings each week.
The average time you spent in double booked or redundant meetings or sending more than two emails per hour in meetings each week.
The average time you spent with people outside of your organization.
The average time you spent in redundant meetings.
The average number of meetings you attend each week.

metric: Time Spent in Meetings 30-59 min Duration
description: The average number of 30 to 59 minute meetings you attend each week.
The average number of emails you receive each week.
The average number of emails you send each week.
The average number of email attachments you send each week.
The average number of meetings you had with a person at least one level above you each week.
The average number of meetings you had with a person at least two levels above you each week.
The average number of one-on-one meetings you attended each week.
The average time you spent in one-on-one meetings each week.
The percent of a team's meetings and emails in which the manager of the team was involved
The average time you spent meeting with your direct manager
The average ratio of time you spent in meetings compared to your managers.
The number of connections you have within your company. A connection is made with at least two emails or meetings involving less than five people.
The number of internal departments in which you have at least one connection.
The number of connections you have outside your company. A connection is made with an email or meeting involving less than five people.
The number of external domains in which you have at least one connection. A connection is made with at least two meetings or emails involving less than 5 people.
The average number of connections within your job function.
The average number of connections within your job level.
The average number of connections within your geographic region.
The average number of connections within your organization.
The average number of new connections per month.
The average time spent collaborating with each internal connection per month
The percent of time you spent emailing and meeting within your organization, relative to your total time emailing and meeting
The percent of time you spent emailing and meeting within your job function, , relative to your total time emailing and meeting.
